intro: Fimbristylis willdenowiana, commonly known as the narrow-leaved flatsedge, is a member of the Cyperaceae family, characterized by its grass-like appearance. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wet or seasonally wet environments, such as marshes and swampy areas. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in dense clusters. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread and form dense mats in suitable habitats. Fimbristylis willdenowiana is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, contributing to the ecological diversity of wetland ecosystems.
